newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore rubber sleepy, buyers await leads.
newsitem.headline: Singapore rubber sleepy, buyers await leads.

text.p: A quiet tone pervaded the Singapore rubber market by midday as the trade waited for leads with some hoping buying will emerge later on Monday, dealers said.
"We're just getting started on the day. Nobody among the major consumers has called up yet so we're waiting for some leads from Japan," a dealer said.
Dealers said the rest of the trade was just beginning to trickle in after attending an industry meeting in the Indonesian resort of Bali over the weekend.
"We'll start making our calls in the afternoon. That's the time the consumers will start sniffing around for any purchases," a trader said.

The market was still a bit nervous about the wobbly state of Southeast Asian currencies, prompting some players to stay cautiously on the sidelines. "There's still some anxiety about the currency market," a dealer said.

At 0445 GMT, September RSS3 was indicated at 94.50 U.S. cents a kg from 95.25 cents. September RSS1 was indicated at 139.50 Singapore cents (95 U.S. cents) a kg from 139.75 cents. -- (S$1.46 = US$1) - Rene Pastor (65-8703305)
